meanings.sent1: The examiner carefully looked at the patient's x-rays.
meanings.sent2: The school examiner checked the students' test papers.
meanings.sent3: The examiner found a surprise in the old book - a hidden note!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like an examiner's, seeing every detail in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The examiner's magnifying glass revealed tiny fingerprints on the document.

meanings.definition: A person who administers an examination.
meanings.sent1: The examiner handed out the test papers to the students.
meanings.sent2: The driving examiner observed the learner driver's skills.
meanings.sent3: The examiner joked that the test was so hard, even a genius would struggle!
meanings.sent4: She was an examiner of truth, seeking out lies with precision.
meanings.sent5: The examiner's stern face made the students nervous during the exam.

meanings.definition: A person who questions or interrogates.
meanings.sent1: The police examiner interviewed the witness about the crime.
meanings.sent2: The job examiner asked the candidate about their work experience.
meanings.sent3: The examiner playfully teased the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an examiner's scalpel, cutting through the lies.
meanings.sent5: The examiner's intense gaze made the suspect confess to the crime.
